meanings.definition: Not guided by or based on good sense
meanings.sent1: It was unreasonable to expect a cat to bark like a dog.
meanings.sent2: She thought it was unreasonable to stay up all night before an important test.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a flying elephant seemed unreasonable to the children.
meanings.sent4: His request for a million dollars was met with an unreasonable amount of laughter.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's rule against using pencils was so unreasonable that the students rebelled.

meanings.definition: Exceeding the limits of reason or moderation
meanings.sent1: Eating ten cookies in one sitting is unreasonable.
meanings.sent2: The price of the designer bag was so unreasonable that she decided not to buy it.
meanings.sent3: The cat's demand for a daily massage was deemed unreasonable by its owner.
meanings.sent4: The amount of homework given over the weekend was unreasonable.
meanings.sent5: The size of the ice cream cone was so unreasonable that it toppled over.

meanings.definition: Not in accordance with practical realities
meanings.sent1: His dream of becoming a superhero was unreasonable.
meanings.sent2: The plan to build a castle out of toothpicks seemed unreasonable to everyone.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a talking unicorn was considered unreasonable by the scientists.
meanings.sent4: Her expectation of finding a pot of gold at the end of the rainbow was unreasonable.
meanings.sent5: The proposal to travel to Mars using a paper airplane was deemed unreasonable by the experts.
